three the discovery of oxygen and 1774

discovered a little something that I'm

logistic ated air we call it oxygen
Priestley figured out how to isolate
this and other gases seemingly from
nowhere by using a pneumatic trough
which is basically an upside-down jars
suspended in a trough of water he
basically just fill the bottle with
water and inverted it into a trough
which was also full of water and from
that first bottle he ran a tube into
another bottle in which he put various
compounds he wanted to study and then he
heated them up the gas is released from
the heating then bubbled up through the
tube displacing the water inside the
first bottle filling it with gas
Priestley heated all kinds of stuff with
this pneumatic trough and in this way he
discovered nitric oxide a hydrogen
chloride ammonia sulfur dioxide and
nitrous oxide among others but his most
important discovery was oxygen which he
isolated by focusing a beam of sunlight

number two the discovery of ions Michael

now Faraday was great at discovering

he will wrote back suggesting the name
